channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What we could learn from the Justice Department's Epstein files release
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with investigative reporter Vicky Ward about what could be revealed in the Justice Department's Epstein files.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with investigative reporter Vicky Ward about what could be revealed in the Justice Department's Epstein files.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Trump signs executive order that could ease marijuana restrictions
item.description: Trump's executive order stops short of legalizing marijuana for recreational use, but will allow more research and medical treatment, and will clear the way for Medicare to cover some cannabis-related treatments.
item.content:encoded: Trump's executive order stops short of legalizing marijuana for recreational use, but will allow more research and medical treatment, and will clear the way for Medicare to cover some cannabis-related treatments.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Meet the new WaPo food critic who won't dine in anonymity
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel tags along for lunch with Elazar Sontag, the Washington Post's new food critic.
item.content:encoded:
Morning Edition about ending anonymity and rethinking how restaurant criticism can feel more accessible.'/>

NPR's Leila Fadel tags along for lunch with Elazar Sontag, the Washington Post's new food critic.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Justice Department official says full Epstein files won't come by Friday deadline
item.description: Friday is the deadline for the government to release files related to the life and death of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. There are still questions about what will be published and when.
item.content:encoded:
Friday is the deadline for the government to release files related to the life and death of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. There are still questions about what will be published and when.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: What to watch for in this weekend's College Football Playoff first round
item.description: An unpredictable and exciting college football season is coming to a close. This weekend's first-round slate is set up for two tight games and two blowouts — but in the playoffs, anything goes.
item.content:encoded:
An unpredictable and exciting college football season is coming to a close. This weekend's first-round slate is set up for two tight games and two blowouts — but in the playoffs, anything goes.

(Image credit: (From left to right) Michael Reaves/Getty Images; Chris Bernacchi/Diamond Images via Getty Images; Joe Buvid/ISI Photos via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The suspect in the Brown University shooting was found dead, police say, Friday is the deadline for the DOJ to release the Epstein files, Trump to add his own name to the Kennedy Center.
item.content:encoded: The suspect in the Brown University shooting was found dead, police say, Friday is the deadline for the DOJ to release the Epstein files, Trump to add his own name to the Kennedy Center.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Cuba on edge as U.S. moves against Venezuela risk fuel shortages and deeper isolation
item.description: Cuba is watching nervously as the U.S. ramps up pressure on Venezuela, threatening a lifeline and deepening the island's isolation.
item.content:encoded: Cuba is watching nervously as the U.S. ramps up pressure on Venezuela, threatening a lifeline and deepening the island's isolation.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: After years of war, Palestinians in Gaza bring back Christmas celebrations
item.description: Palestinians in Gaza are slowly bringing back Christmas celebrations after more than two years of war. The Holy Family Church in Gaza City gathered this week to decorate the church.
item.content:encoded: Palestinians in Gaza are slowly bringing back Christmas celebrations after more than two years of war. The Holy Family Church in Gaza City gathered this week to decorate the church.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: ABC News' Jonathan Karl unpacks Trump's behavior this week
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep looks back at President Trump's behavior over the past week with Jonathan Karl of ABC News. He's the author of "Retribution: Donald Trump and the Campaign That Changed America."
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep looks back at President Trump's behavior over the past week with Jonathan Karl of ABC News. He's the author of "Retribution: Donald Trump and the Campaign That Changed America."
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: With cases ramping up, experts worry the U.S. is in for another bad flu season
item.description: Flu cases are soaring in New York and picking up in other parts of the country. Experts worry it will be another bad season. COVID and RSV have been less of a problem, but they're also on the rise.
item.content:encoded: Flu cases are soaring in New York and picking up in other parts of the country. Experts worry it will be another bad season. COVID and RSV have been less of a problem, but they're also on the rise.
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein
